short_reason: CON wins through superior comparative weighing and effective clash. While PRO identified harms, CON successfully framed these as fringe cases versus widespread benefits. CON's argument that extremism doesn't define the whole phenomenon, combined with concrete examples of charitable work and community building, outweighed PRO's failure to comparatively weigh systemic harms against systemic benefits. CON's rebuttal strategy of distinguishing extremism from mainstream practice was more persuasive than PRO's assertion that positive aspects don't redeem negative ones.
